New Records: Rohit Sharma scored the fastest century for an Indian batsman in a World Cup game
Rohit Sharma broke a plethora of records, including most World Cup hundreds for an Indian batsman, third on the list of all-time ODI hundreds, and most sixes in international cricket
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma and Ishan Kishan set a hectic pace, scoring 50 off 37 balls and 50 off 34 balls respectively
Sharma got to 50 off 30 balls, the second quickest in this World Cup
Kishan was out caught in the 19th over
Kohli walked out to bat at his home ground with the capacity crowd at the Arun Jaitely Stadium chanting his name
India wrapped up the win with 90 balls to spare
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's performance and momentum going into the tournament
The team's next game is against archrival Pakistan in Ahmedabad on Saturday
Miscellaneous Highlights: Earlier, Hashmatullah Shahidi and Azmatullah Omarzai put on a 121-run partnership, the second highest ever in the World Cup for Afghanistan
Mohammed Siraj proved expensive, finishing with 0-76 from nine overs, his joint most expensive spell in ODIs
